metadata.title: CVE-2016-3627 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The xmlStringGetNodeList function in tree.c in libxml2 2.9.3 and earlier,when used in recovery mode, allows context-dependent attackers to cause adenial of service (infinite recursion, stack consumption, and applicationcrash) via a crafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1').
